org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the District of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Tacoma, in and for Pierce County, Wash. Terry.
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx In the matter of application of x x M.A. WALKER, x Habeas Corpus x for a Writ of Habeas Corpus x xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
To the Honorable John, P. Hoyt, Judge of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Tacoma, in and for Pierce County, Washington Territory.
The petition of M. A. Walker, respectfully shows: ---

That he, the said petitioner, is unlawfully imprisoned, contained, confined and restrained of his liberty by Lewis Byrd, Sheriff of said Pierce County, Washington Territory, and that he is imprisoned in the County jail of said County, at Tacoma.

That the cause or pretense of said confinement is as follows:-- On the 16th of July 1885, at about 2 oclock in the morning of that day one William Lockwood was struck by an engine and car on the track of the Northern Pacific Railroad in Tacoma aforesaid, and was run over and cut, bruised and killed. That this petitioner was arrested on suspicion o having killed said Lockwood, and was on the 23rd day of July 1885, examined before A. Campbell, Esq, a justice of the peace, and ordered to be confined in said jail without bail to await the action of the grand jury, and that said Lewis Byrd, Sheriff, detains him by virtue of said warrant of commitment.

That the substance of all the testimony, and the material parts of all the evidence, and all the testimony and evidence taken before said A. Campbell Esq. tending to connect this petitioner with said crime are set forth in "Exhibit A". which is heats annexed and hereby made past of this Complaint and afed petition.

taken or presented before said justice of the peace that said William Lockwood was killed, or attempted to be killed, or was s truck, stabbed, shot or otherwise hurt or assaulted, or was in anywise injured or attempted to be injured by this petitioner, or by or through his assistance, knowledge or connivance; or that he met his death or was killed by this petitioner, or that this petitioner was in anywise accessory thereto; but said evidence only tended to show that said deceased was killed on said railroad track by being struck and run over by an engine and car on said track, and by accident,
